message.content:
### Status of OpenAI GPT-5
- **Not Released**: As of October 2024, OpenAI has not publicly released GPT-5. No official announcement confirms its launch or specific details like parameters, capabilities, or benchmarks.
- **Rumors and Speculation**: 
  - OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has teased "GPT-5" in interviews (e.g., June 2024 Lex Fridman podcast), describing it as a major leap but without timelines. He mentioned internal testing of advanced models.
  - Reports suggest training is ongoing, potentially delayed due to compute shortages and safety evaluations (e.g., Reuters, July 2024).
  - Leaks from sources like The Information (Sept 2024) claim a possible late 2024 or 2025 release, but these are unverified.
- **Current OpenAI Flagship**: GPT-4o (May 2024) remains the latest, powering ChatGPT. OpenAI's "o1" series (Sept 2024) focuses on reasoning, not branded as GPT-5.

**Sources**:
- [OpenAI Blog](https://openai.com/index) (no GPT-5 mention).
- [Sam Altman on Lex Fridman (YouTube)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rxbZq1XKHTQ) (~1:45:00 mark).
- [Reuters: OpenAI's next model delayed](https://www.reuters.com/technology/artificial-intelligence/openais-next-frontier-model-faces-delay-sources-say-2024-07-02/).
- [The Information: GPT-5 rumors](https://www.theinformation.com/articles/openai-weighs-whether-to-release-gpt-5-this-year).

For updates, check OpenAI's official channels.
